snippet: Residents of Nathkuva, next to the hulking coolant gas factory, complain of rashes and birth defects, which they say are the result of pollution from the plant.
abstract: Residents of Nathkuva, India, next to a hulking coolant gas factory, complain of rashes and birth defects, which they say are the result of pollution from the plant; hulking factory that looms behind the tiny vegetable plots in this poor village is one of the largest manufacturers of a coolant gas that keeps air-conditioners whirring across the globe; environmental groups and residents have been at loggerheads with the company that was issued carbon credits by the United Nations in 2005.
lead_paragraph: Residents of Nathkuva, next to the hulking coolant gas factory, complain of rashes and birth defects, which they say are the result of pollution from the plant.

headline.seo: Indian Village at Odds With Gujarat Fluorochemicals Plant
headline.main: In a Factory’s Shadow, Fears About Health
headline.print_headline: In a Factory’s Shadow, Fears About Health
